de.thwildau.app.amber

Class VehicleActivity<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
              • android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity
                • de.thwildau.app.amber.VehicleActivity<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public class VehicleActivity<T>
extends android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity
    This class displays the vehiclelist, which contains the vehicles of the user. The list objects consists of data which will also displayed. The preparation and the displaying of the data is managed by another class VehicleListAdapter. This class manages the user inputs, calls server requests and handle the data of server responses.
    Since:
    2015-01-08
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kulla
    See Also:
    ActionBarActivity

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when the activity is first created. It sets the activity content data like view layout and title. It loads the userid from shared preferences in the local data storage. It registers the broadcast managers to broadcast server response messages. It creates the list adapter (and passes the data that should displayed) to display the object information. Also it prepares the list for user interaction with creating click listeners.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The previously state of the activity.

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
        This method handles the click events of the action bar icons. It contains the add vehicle dialog to add a new vehicle to the vehiclelist and the backpress event from back button.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        item - Action bar item the user has clicked on.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        Method to create a modified action bar to add customized action bar buttons.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        menu - The menu xml file which contains the elements.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Method to handle back press / logout of the user. This method sends a logout request of the user to the server to change the database.
        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity

      • fillData

        public void fillData()
        This method gets the intent data from the server (vehicle objects from the user) and fills the vehiclelist with it.

      • addListItem

        public void addListItem(int vehicle_id)
        This method adds an vehicle to the vehiclelist and sends a request to the server to change the database.
        Parameters:
        vehicle_id - The unique id of an vehicle.

      • removeListItem

        public void removeListItem(int index)
        This method removes an vehicle of the vehiclelist and sends a request to the server to change the database.
        Parameters:
        index - The position/index of the vehicle object in the list.

      • toggleAlarm

        public void toggleAlarm(android.view.View v)
        This method changes the alarm status of a vehicle in the list and sends a request to the server. The alarm status represents the receiving of the notifications.
        Parameters:
        v - View of the pressed listview element.

      • getContext

        public static android.content.Context getContext()
        This method returns the application context.
        Returns:
        Context The application context.

      • setEmptyList

        public void setEmptyList(android.widget.ListView lv)
        This method is called if the list contains no vehicle objects. In the list an information for the user will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        lv - The listview that should show the information.

      • startProgressDialog

        public void startProgressDialog(android.content.Context context)
        This method will be called when the user clicks on a vehicle. It creates a background task which creates a progress dialog to tide over the time which is needed to load the eventlist and finally change the activity.
        Parameters:
        context -

      • getSupportFragmentManager

        public android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager getSupportFragmentManager()
